course.title: The Incas: The Last Great Empire of Pre-Columbian South America
course.meeting_text: Tu., Th., 1-2:30, and a weekly section to be arranged.
course.description: This course guides students on an exploration of the largest and most complex civilization of Pre-Columbian America-the Inca Empire of Andean South America. We will address such questions as how did a civilization emerge and thrive at 12,000 feet above sea level? How could a state-level society exist without markets, the wheel, or writing? In addition to lectures and discussions, students will experience the products of Inca civilization through hands-on study of artifacts in the Peabody Museum of Archaeology and Ethnology.
course.notes: This course fulfills the requirement that one of the eight General Education courses also engage substantially with Study of the Past.
